title: Bug 120922: "Dirty Page" behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement
description: Bug 120922: "Dirty Page" behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improved. Other pages cannot be used until the source is saved. And then the user needs to figure out how to save or discard their changes. The dialog is titled "Error" (including the quotes).
OB: If you edit the XML in the "source" view of the Layout Editor and then try to switch back to the Layout view, you will get an error message indicating that you need to save your changes. This problem is that the user has to figure out what they need to do to save the changes (or discard them, which is even harder), and the error message is not very clear. The error message is "Source page is dirty."
EB: A better and more typical approach would be to display a dialog with a clear title indicating that the XML Report Design has been changed. The dialog should not have quotes in its title.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open the XML Report Designer.
2. Edit the XML in the "source" view of the Layout Editor.
3. Attempt to switch back to the Layout view.
4. Observe the error message indicating that you need to save your changes.
